keymaps.name: Colemak for PC
keymaps.description: Colemak is based on QWERTY, but it places the most frequent letters under the strongest fingers. This is the PC version.

keymaps.name: Colemax
keymaps.description:
A special layout to be used with a base layer of Colemak configured on the PC.
This layout has some unique assignments of Mod, Fn, and Mouse layers to make it compatible with Max' AutoHotKey script Maxmax.ahk. Beware that on this layout, the Mod function is mapped to the Capslock position (Mouse key) as a secondary function. Primary is Backspace (normal for Colemak layouts).

keymaps.name: Dvorak for PC
keymaps.description: The Dvorak keyboard layout was designed with the goal of maximizing typing efficiency. This is the PC version.

keymaps.name: Nummax
keymaps.description:
A special layout to be used together with Colemax. This implements a NumLock layer for this layout.
This layout has some unique assignments of Mod, Fn, and Mouse layers to make it compatible with Max' AutoHotKey script Maxmax.ahk. Beware that on this layout, the Mod function is mapped to the Capslock position (Mouse key) as a secondary function. Primary is Backspace (normal for Colemak layouts).

keymaps.name: Nummax 2
keymaps.description:
A special layout to be used together with Colemax. This implements an alternative NumLock layer for this layout.
This layout has some unique assignments of Mod, Fn, and Mouse layers to make it compatible with Max' AutoHotKey script Maxmax.ahk. Beware that on this layout, the Mod function is mapped to the Capslock position (Mouse key) as a secondary function. Primary is Backspace (normal for Colemak layouts).

keymaps.name: Pause
keymaps.description:
A special layout to be used with a base layer of Colemak configured on the PC.
This layout has some unique assignments of Mod, Fn, and Mouse layers to make it compatible with Max' AutoHotKey script Maxmax.ahk. Beware that on this layout, the Mod function is mapped to the Capslock position (Mouse key) as a secondary function. Primary is Backspace (normal for Colemak layouts).

keymaps.name: QWERTY for PC
keymaps.description: QWERTY is the mother of all layouts. This is the PC version.

macroActions.command:
set leds.fadeTimeout 5
set module.trackpoint.baseSpeed 0
set module.trackpoint.speed 0.7
set module.trackpoint.xceleration 0.7
clearStatus

setLedTxt 5000 CMX
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 ::C
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 :C:
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 C:M
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 :M:
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 M:X
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 :X:
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 :::
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 ::C
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 :CM
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 CMX
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 300 :::
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 300 CMX
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 300 :::
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 CMX

macros.name: Go to UHK site in browser

macroActions.command:
setReg 0 6
startloop:
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 `-'
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 ---
ifKeymap --- repeatFor 0 startloop

ifNotKeymap --- goTo final
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 ---
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 }--
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 -}-
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 --}

ifNotKeymap --- goTo final
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 ---
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 --{
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 -{-
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 {--

final: 
setLedTxt 1000 [-]
setLedTxt 200 [\]
setLedTxt 200 [|]
setLedTxt 200 [/]
setLedTxt 200 [-]
setLedTxt 200 [\]
setLedTxt 200 [|]
setLedTxt 200 [/]
setLedTxt 200 [-]
setLedTxt 200 [*]
setLedTxt 200 |_|

ifShift goTo shiftMaxtend
ifAlt goTo altMaxtend
resolveSecondary 200 0 primaryaction secondaryaction

secondaryaction:
setLedTxt 0 MAX
holdLayer mod
setLedTxt 1 MAX
break

primaryaction:
tapKey backspace
setLedTxt 500 <--
break

shiftMaxtend:
setLedTxt 0 <--
suppressMods holdKey backspace
ifNotPlaytime 300 final setLedTxt 300 <--
setLedTxt 1 <--
break

altMaxtend:
setLedTxt 0 DEL
suppressMods holdKey delete
ifNotPlaytime 300 final setLedTxt 300 DEL
setLedTxt 1 DEL
break

ifShift goTo shiftMaxtend
//ifAlt final suppressMods holdKey delete
setLedTxt 0 MAX
holdLayer mod
ifReleased setLedTxt 1 MAX
ifInterrupted break
ifPlaytime 300 break
tapKey backspace
setLedTxt 500 <--
break
shiftMaxtend:
setLedTxt 0 <--
suppressMods holdKey backspace
ifReleased setLedTxt 1 MAX

holdLayer mod
ifInterrupted break
ifPlaytime 300 break
toggleLayer mod

holdLayer previous
ifInterrupted break
ifPlaytime 300 break
unToggleLayer

resolveSecondary 300 150 primaryaction secondaryaction
primaryaction: final tapKey space
secondaryaction: final holdLayer mouse

ifShift goTo shiftTab
//ifAlt final suppressMods holdKey delete
setLedTxt 0 NUM
holdLayer fn5
ifReleased setLedTxt 1 NUM
ifInterrupted break
ifPlaytime 300 break
tapKey tab
setLedTxt 500 ->|
break
shiftTab:
setLedTxt 0 |<-
holdKey tab
setLedTxt 500 |<-
